newsitem.title: JAPAN: Recent data shows Japan economy recovering -- BOJ.
newsitem.headline: Recent data shows Japan economy recovering -- BOJ.

text.p: Recent economic data shows that the Japanese economy is on a recovery path, a senior Bank of Japan (BOJ) official said on Monday.

"Indicators in the last two to three months show that the slight setback seen in the August 'tankan' survey was indeed a temporary one," the official, an adviser to the BOJ governor, told Reuters in an interview.

He said data concerning inventory adjustment, private consumption and capital investment had shown an improvement during that period, confirming the central bank's view that the setback was only temporary.
"Data such as machinery orders and industrial production have shown an improvement. Private consumption -- for example, automobile sales -- have also picked up recently," he added.
The tankan is a quarterly corporate survey conducted by the BOJ and is closely watched by the financial markets as a clue to its future monetary policy.

In the last survey released in August, the diffusion index for major manufacturers, a key index, had worsened unexpectedly and BOJ officials had said it was due mainly to a prolonged inventory adjustment in industries such as paper/pulp and steel.
